head.title: Man Accused of False Tainted-Water Claim

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Man Accused of False Tainted-Water Claim

abstract.p: Police arrest Edwardo Pardo in connection with scare over possible tampering of bottled water in New York City, but he is charged only with making a false report; Pardo acknowledges that he tainted his own water in attempt to garner publicity (S)

block.p: The police have made the first arrest in the scare over the possible tampering of bottled water in the New York region. But rather than arrest someone for tampering, officials said, they charged the suspect with falsely reporting a police incident after he tainted his own water.

Yesterday evening, the police said that Edwardo Pardo, 31, of Washington Heights, acknowledged that he was trying to garner publicity last Thursday night, when he darted into the bathroom at Frank's Gym, at 4271 Broadway, and poured Clorox bleach into a bottle of Poland Spring water. Mr. Pardo told the authorities he felt a burning sensation in his mouth after drinking from the bottle.
